definition: Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]

sentences.english: Do the coffee beans have a little pink skin covering them or inside the crack of the bean?
sentences.chinese: 豆子夾縫中或是表面上是否有粉紅色的銀皮覆蓋住呢？

sentences.english: They aligned themselves with one side, or got ground between millstones.
sentences.chinese: 他們必須與一方結盟，或在夾縫中求生。

sentences.english: The newborn has fallen between the cracks.
Or in black and white crevice sad ash?
sentences.chinese: 還是黑白夾縫中沉悶的灰？

sentences.english: Trousers and collars caught on both sides with black satin fabrics folder.
sentences.chinese: 褲子兩側夾縫有和領子同面料的黑緞夾條。

sentences.english: Cats were coming out of the cabinets and drawers and were inside the walls.
sentences.chinese: 貓從櫥櫃和抽屜裏進進出出，有的還鑽在牆的夾縫裏。

sentences.english: But his success demonstrates what is possible when you are stuck in between.
sentences.chinese: 但是他展示了夾縫中成功的可能。

sentences.english: World of Warcraft fell between the cracks.
People who don’t want to change are stuck in the rut of life, not a great place to be.
sentences.chinese: 而惰於改變的人陷於生活的夾縫中，無法自拔。

sentences.english: So begins the new coldwar, and India is caught in the middle.
sentences.chinese: 所以新的冷戰開始，印度處在夾縫之中。

definition: to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
ground or first floor/bottom (of a pile)/lowest rung (of society)
